bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, January 28, 1921

div1.p: Carter writes that he must go to Ferrenafe because of a possible yellow fever outbreak.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, January 28, 1921
div1.p:
At 4.45 yesterday I
rec'd an answer to my cable
asking me to go to Ferreñafe-
changed my in changed my
transportation from Callao
to Eten - to which place I
sail tomorrow-

Well! I offered to go because it
was right to do so. I sh'd then be
glad - or at least approving-
that the Salubridad was
wise enough to accept my
offer.
2. m.
offer, I suppose I should, ac-
count it a privelege to do
have a chance to do what may
well be important work a-
gainst y. f. aswith the very last
bit of my stay in Peru &
frankly I do so account
it. Nevertheless it is a nui-
sance.

I am not one of those who
think that all duties must
-that being disagreeable it must be a duty-
be disagreeable - but I will
say that a big amount of
my duties have been-
& this not among the least,
nevertheless
3
nevertheless- the matter is very
clear & the chance to (1) clear up
a possible mistake in diagno-
sis- I fear that there is none- or fail-
ing this (2) to plan & iniciate
a proper campaign for the
elimination of y. f. which
should not exist, is one
to be accepted & carried
out- Only I do grievously
regret the occasion.

It is so horribly hot. The
cement in my bifocal glasses
is starring - (104°F+): & it is getting
hotter-, Lima is cool enough
4
But the chiclayo country is about
like Piura. I thought that
tomorrow-, here,- & only 1/2 the
day - would be my last hot
weather except a few hot
days in the Isthmus &
the Caribean.

This is all foolishness how-
ever - the two or three weeks
I will spend - in much dis-
comfort I admit - in
Lambayeque (Departments)
is as nothing to the fact, if it
be a fact, that that there is y. f.
there or to the chance of con-
troling & then extirpating
it, if it be in Ferreñafe.
c
5
Also my Laundry needs at-
tention. I have been afraid
to have any done since
the 14. & will need clean
things next week- Well
that is a minor thing- In-
deed every thing is a
minor consideration to
(1) the situation in Lamba-
yeque & the then meas-
ures necessary for reme-
dying it.

I judge it will take about
nexttwo weeks & don't think
it will take more than
6
three weeks.

At any rate I have left Pi-
ura - & it may that it will be
far less comfortable where
I am going - I judge it will
be,

God bless you my Dear, &
I hope to get off within two
or three weeks for Lima & about a
week, there.
div1.closer:
Your - disappoin-
ted- yet satisfied Daddy,
30 Enero: The paquete
was 2 bottles of Benzyl-
Benzoate from Hynseni
Westcott- Just opened,
when shipped I don't know
If I meet Hanson at Eten
anyhow I will get a lot of your
letter.
H. R. C.
